root.OPHeading2: Notices of Motions for Unopposed Returns
root.BusinessItemHeadingBulleted: NOTICE OF MOTION FOR AN UNOPPOSED RETURN

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Lora, serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;

from_cdata.span: That an humble Address be presented to His Majesty, That he will be graciously pleased to give directions that there be laid before this House a Return of the Report, entitled Protecting our Democracy from Coercion, dated 21

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Lora, serif; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Lora, serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;

root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: Children (Parental Imprisonment): Ten Minute Rule Motion

MotionText.from_cdata: That leave be given to bring in a Bill to require the Secretary of State to establish national policy guidelines in respect of children with a parent in prison, including for the identification of the children of prisoners at the point of sentence and for accountability for providing support to the children of prisoners; and for connected purposes.

from_cdata.p: The Member moving and a Member opposing this Motion may each speak for up to 10 minutes.

root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: DIGITAL MARKETS, COMPETITION AND CONSUMERS BILL: CONSIDERATION OF LORDS MESSAGE
root.DebateTimingRubric: Up to one hour (Order of 30 April)

p.style: text-align: left;

from_cdata.p: Nothing in the Lords Message engages Commons Financial Privilege.

p.style: text-align: left;

span.class: ui-provider ec bkt bku bkv bkw bkx bky bkz bla blb blc bld ble blf blg blh bli blj blk bll blm bln blo blp blq blr bls blt blu blv blw blx bly blz bma

p.span: For a motion relating to the Lords Message, see separate paper (also available on the publications webpage for the Bill).

MotionText.from_cdata: That the draft Scotland Act 1998 (Increase of Borrowing Limits) Order 2024, which was laid before this House on 17 April, be approved.

root.DebateTimingRubric: Until any hour (if the 7.00pm Business of the House motion is agreed to)

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Lora, serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;

from_cdata.span: That at this day’s sitting, the Speaker shall put the Questions necessary to dispose of proceedings on the Motion in the name of Secretary Mark Harper relating to the High Speed Rail (Crewe – Manchester) Bill: Instruction (No. 3) not later than 90 minutes after the commencement of proceedings on the Motion for this Order; such Questions shall include the Questions on any Amendments selected by the Speaker which may then be moved; proceedings on that Motion may continue, though opposed, after the moment of interruption; and Standing Order No. 41A (Deferred divisions) shall not apply.

MotionText.from_cdata: That, at this day’s sitting, (1) Standing Order No. 41A (Deferred divisions) shall not apply to the Motion in the name of Secretary Alister Jack relating to Constitutional Law; and (2) the Motion in the name of Penny Mordaunt, relating to Business of the House (Today) may be proceeded with, though opposed, until any hour and Standing Order No. 41A (Deferred divisions) shall not apply.

root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: HIGH SPEED RAIL (CREWE – MANCHESTER) BILL: INSTRUCTION (No. 3)
root.DebateTimingRubric: Up to 90 minutes from the start of proceedings on the Business of the House (Today) motion (if that motion is agreed to)

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

from_cdata.p: That it be an instruction to the Select Committee to which the High Speed Rail (Crewe – Manchester) Bill is committed to deal with the Bill as follows:

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (1) The Committee shall, before concluding its proceedings, amend the Bill by—

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt 36pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (a) leaving out provision relating to a railway between a junction with Phase 2a of High Speed 2 south of Crewe in Cheshire and a point in the vicinity of the parish of Millington and Rostherne in Cheshire,

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt 36pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (b) leaving out provision relating to a railway between Hoo Green in Cheshire and a junction with the West Coast Main Line at Bamfurlong, south of Wigan, and

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt 36pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (c) making such amendments to the Bill as it thinks fit in consequence of the amendments made by virtue of sub-paragraphs (a) and (b).

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (2) The Committee shall not hear any petition to the extent that it—

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt 36pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (a) relates to whether or not there should be—

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt 72pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (i) a railway between a junction with Phase 2a of High Speed 2 south of Crewe in Cheshire and a point in the vicinity of the parish of Millington and Rostherne in Cheshire, or

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt 72pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (ii) a railway between Hoo Green in Cheshire and a junction with the West Coast Main Line at Bamfurlong, south of Wigan, or

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt 36pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (b) otherwise relates to a railway mentioned in sub-paragraph (a).

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (3) The Committee shall treat the principle of the Bill, as determined by the House on the Bill’s Second Reading, as comprising the matters mentioned in paragraph (4); and those matters shall accordingly not be at issue during proceedings of the Committee.

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (4) The matters referred to in paragraph (3) are—

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt 36pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (a) the provision of a high speed railway between a point in the vicinity of the parish of Millington and Rostherne in Cheshire and Manchester Piccadilly Station,

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt 36pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (b) in relation to the railway mentioned in sub-paragraph (a) as set out on the plans deposited in January 2022 in connection with the Bill in the office of the Clerk of the Parliaments and the Private Bill Office of the House of Commons, its broad route alignment, and

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt 36pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (c) the fact that there are to be no new stations (other than Manchester Piccadilly and Manchester Airport) on the railway mentioned in sub-paragraph (a).

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (5) The Committee shall have power to consider any amendments proposed by the member in charge of the Bill which, if the Bill were a private bill, could not be made except upon petition for additional provision.

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: (6) Paragraph (5) applies only so far as the amendments proposed by the member in charge of the Bill fall within the principle of the Bill as provided for by paragraphs (3) and (4) above.

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: That these Orders be Standing Orders of the House.

p.style: margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: That the Order of 20 June 2022 (High Speed Rail (Crewe – Manchester) Bill: Instruction (No. 2)) be rescinded.

root.MotionAmmendmentText: Paragraph (1)(a), line 2, leave out from “vicinity of” to end and insert— “Chainage 281+350 in the parish of Millington and Rostherne in Cheshire, including all structures relating to a junction with the now cancelled Phase 2b railway between this point and a junction with Phase 2a of High Speed 2 south of Crewe,”
After paragraph (1)(b) insert— “() leaving out provision for the Ashley Infrastructure Maintenance Base - Rail, and”
Paragraph (1)(c), line 2, leave out “and (b)” and insert “, (b) and ()”
root.DebateTimingRubric: No debate or decision (Standing Order No. 153)

from_cdata.p: The subject for this debate was determined by the Backbench Business Committee.

root.MotionText: That this House has considered support for bereaved children : Andy Carter

from_cdata.p: The sitting will be suspended from 11.30am to 2.30pm.

root.MotionText: That this House has considered bus services in England: Jonathan Gullis
That this House has considered Knife Crime Awareness Week: Fleur Anderson
That this House has considered endometriosis education in schools: Sir Alec Shelbrooke

span.style: color: #333333; font-family: 'helvetica neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

p.span: The debate at 4.30pm will last for up to an hour.

span.style: color: #333333; font-family: 'helvetica neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

p.span: The sitting will be suspended and time added if divisions take place in the main Chamber (Standing Order No. 10(3)).
